titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson to William A. Dudley
CWG1299

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1862-1863

body.p:
Executive Department
Frankfort K. Oct 30 /62
W. A. Dudley Esq
Quarter Master General
Dear Sir
Your letter of the 27th inst., tendering your resignation of the office of Quarter Master General of the State, to take effect on the 1st proximo, has been received.

I regret the causes which have impelled you to this step, and more especially that which refers to your enfeebled state of health. The fidelty and ability with which you have discharged the duties of the position from which you now, voluntarily, propose to retire, have been such as to command my most hearty approbation; and I do not hesitate to say that, in your withdrawal from it, the State loses the services of a competent, faithful and reliable officer.
In accepting your resignation, for the causes which you have assigned, I beg to reciprocate your expressions of kindness, and to wish you a speedy restoration of your accustomed health and vigor.

I am very truly yours
J. F. Robinson

Qr Mr General
W. A. Dudley
